expert.name: Rhonda Patrick
expert.bio: Biomedical scientist focused on nutritional health, aging, and prevention. Known for deep dives into micronutrients and heat/cold stress.

interventions.name: Sauna (Finnish Style)
interventions.description: 174-190°F sauna for 20 minutes, 4-7x per week. Mimics cardiovascular exercise, induces heat shock proteins, and reduces all-cause mortality.

interventions.name: Sauna + Cold Contrast
interventions.description: Alternate between sauna (20 min) and cold exposure (1-2 min) for 2-3 cycles. Enhances hormetic stress response.

interventions.name: Time-Restricted Eating
interventions.description: Confine eating to 8-10 hour window, ideally starting earlier in the day to align with circadian rhythm.

interventions.name: Broccoli Sprout Consumption
interventions.description: Grow and consume fresh broccoli sprouts (50-100g) for maximum sulforaphane content.

protocols.name: Rhonda Patrick Longevity Stack
protocols.description: Core supplement stack focused on filling common nutrient gaps and supporting longevity pathways.

nutrition_principles.guidance: Eat within an 8-10 hour window, starting earlier in the day (e.g., 8am-6pm). This aligns with circadian rhythm and improves metabolic markers.
Prioritize wild-caught fatty fish (salmon, mackerel, sardines) 2-3x per week. Supplement to reach 4g EPA/DHA daily if not consuming fish.
Consume cruciferous vegetables (broccoli, kale, Brussels sprouts) daily for sulforaphane and other isothiocyanates. Chop and let sit 40 minutes before cooking to maximize myrosinase activity.
Eat a variety of colorful fruits and vegetables daily to obtain diverse polyphenols. Each color represents different phytonutrients.
Distribute protein intake across meals (30-40g per meal) rather than loading at one meal. This optimizes muscle protein synthesis throughout the day.
Target 25-35g fiber daily from whole food sources for gut microbiome health and short-chain fatty acid production.
